intro: Macaranga lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf macaranga, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsules that contain numerous seeds.
